snippet: When President Obama nominated Jeh C. Johnson, his former legal adviser, to be the next secretary of homeland security, it reignited criticism of the department.
abstract: Pres Obama’s nomination of Jeh C Johnson as the next secretary of homeland security reignites criticism of department and leads Republicans and Democrats to blame one another for its problems; Johnson does not appear to face major obstacles for confirmation by the Democratic-controlled Senate.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and JULIA PRESTON
byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt reported from Washington, and Julia Preston from New York. Michael D. Shear contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: When President Obama nominated Jeh C. Johnson, his former legal adviser, to be the next secretary of homeland security, it reignited criticism of the department.

headline.main: Nomination Revives Debate Over Homeland Security
headline.print_headline:
Nomination Revives Debate
Over Homeland Security
